column4: i am using kubuntu/I have firestarter installed/When i start firestarter it keeps telling me (wrong) pass word.
your password - try that - if not I don't know how you set it up
!firestarter | Radi01
It tells me I dont have root privys..and Ive done everything..oi.
su/gksudo/sudo -i  U name it
how did you install it?
add remove
I have used Ubuntu and had no problems/Now I am trying Kubuntu it acts funky
use guarddog in its place
Is it comparable?
no
when i got root i  tried to start firestarter  and it says it needed a make install-
you have not installed it correctly you are trying to compile it -- this is a package based distro you don't have to install from source. Do this: sudo apt-get install firestarter
add remove  because adept didnt respond..U think my disk might be bad?
il try brb
no idea you might have corrupted your install in some way - best thing there is to back up your data and install freshly if you you want to test
!quicktime | scrapbunny
k ompaul/thanks...1 thing though..the first time i installed kubuntu it worked flawlessly..interesting

then something has broken and ehh you need to work out what it is - sounds like you are unsure of what you have so I would strongly suggest, back up your data and reinstall - if it breaks again randomly then consider a new disk
E: dpkg was interrupted, you must manually run 'dpkg --configure -a' to correct the problem.
you did break your system do sudo dpkg --configure -a and see how you are then
